subtitleNullable: Used car sales data with car make, model, year and more
descriptionNullable:
### Context
This is a data set for used car sales in the US. In total ~160k sales records over a period of 20 months in 2019 and 2020. There won't be any more updates to this dataset as eBay stopped providing full ZIP codes.

### Content
Each sample contains information about a used car sale, like selling price, location, details about the car (Make, model, year, mileage, etc). 
 
The data was scraped from eBay. I tried to filter the data when updating, meaning that if the same seller sells the same car again I'll remove the previous sale as it was most likely not a successful sale (Do you know that [eBay bids on cars are non binding][1]?)

### Acknowledgements
Header Image Credit: [Laitr Keiows \[CC BY 3.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0)\]][2]

### Inspiration
I'm curious what the community can do with this data to identify trends or even predict a fair price for a used car.


  [1]: https://www.ebay.com/help/policies/rules-policies-buyers/nonbinding-bid-policy?id=4228
  [2]: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Parking_lot_at_HAA_Kobe.jpg#filelinks
title: US used car sales data
subtitle: Used car sales data with car make, model, year and more
description:
### Context

### Content
Each sample contains information about a used car sale, like selling price, location, details about the car (Make, model, year, mileage, etc). 
 
The data was scraped from eBay. I tried to filter the data when updating, meaning that if the same seller sells the same car again I'll remove the previous sale as it was most likely not a successful sale (Do you know that [eBay bids on cars are non binding][1]?)

### Acknowledgements
Header Image Credit: [Laitr Keiows \[CC BY 3.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0)\]][2]

### Inspiration
I'm curious what the community can do with this data to identify trends or even predict a fair price for a used car.
